intro: Oldenlandia tardavelina, commonly known as the late-flowering spiderwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly South Africa. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often covered with fine hairs. Oldenlandia tardavelina typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
